qas.question: What component of wood is degraded by bacteria that scientists are still trying to learn about?
What type of bacteria are present in Xylophaga?
What type of wood is it possible the bacteria in Xylophaga help break down?
How long was the wood submerged in water in the study that discovered the types of bacteria in it?
What bacteria starting with the letter "F" were found in wood after it was underwater for more than a year?

context: Little is known about the bacteria that degrade <a0_0>cellulose<a0_0/>. <a1_0>Symbiotic<a1_0/> bacteria in Xylophaga may play a role in the degradation of <a2_0>sunken<a2_0/> wood; while bacteria such as Alphaproteobacteria, <a4_0>Flavobacteria<a4_0/>, Actinobacteria, Clostridia, and Bacteroidetes have been detected in wood submerged <a3_0>over a year<a3_0/>.
